articles.title: S Korea broadband firm sues Netflix after traffic surge from 'Squid Game' - CNA
articles.description:
SEOUL: South Korean Internet service provider SK Broadband has sued Netflix to pay for costs from increased network traffic and maintenance work because of a surge of viewers to the American firm's content, an SK spokesperson said on Friday (Oct 1).

The mo…
articles.content:
Last year, Netflix had brought its own lawsuit on whether it had any obligation to pay SK for network usage, arguing that Netflix's duty ends with creating content and leaving it accessible.
